intro: Senecio riograndensis, commonly known as the Rio Grande groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio riograndensis is adapted to survive in dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
